text: Great hotel food fab also the alacarte meal fantastic. Rooms cleaned everyday,Roof top bar great very relaxing.Quite a way from the beach uphill on the way back.2 different pools one quiet one noisy with swim up bar.

10 day stay for  middle aged couple . we wanted somewhere without any package holiday hoopla but close to  the city so we could have a proper mooch about. this place ticked pretty much all the boxes. room was small but clean and the bathroom shower was better than I had hoped.  Breakfast was plentiful and good. . staff were generally very friendly and the roof terrace was very  pleasant - both for lolling about in the day and for drinks in the evening. Location was outstanding. a walk to the harbour, theatre, restaurants and cable car. We were glad we paid ( a little) extra for a balcony. it was worth it. only reason not a 5 is that the towels provided were..... errrrr.... thin and had seen WAY better days. would be delighted to stay here again. MUCH more fun than an anodyne all inclusive.
Large areas, clean and well taken care of. Different leisure spaces.Various feeding spaces including snaks, outside.

We stayed at this fab hotel over Xmas and New Year and we had an amazing time! From the extremely friendly staff, to the lovely clean rooms and it's great location, we just could not have asked for more!Looking forward to going back!

Ideal place to take children very well decorated rooms several swimming pools one of them heated indoors lots of entertainment for children by far one of the best Vila Galé for children very good buffet food and well organized ideal place to visit

The 1BR apartment was modern, clean, and tastefully decorated.  Our room had a wonderful view of the Porto de Mós beach. The location was great. My husband and I hiked along the coast and walked by the beach every day. It was also about a 20 minute walk to the Ponte da Piedade- which is a must-see if you are visiting Lagos. The two restaurants at the nearby beach were very nice. If you have a car, you can easily go to the supermarkets and restaurants that are a short drive away. However, I wouldn't recommend driving (at night) to the center of Lagos if you are not used to driving on narrow streets surrounded by drunk people.Unfortunately, we stayed here on their off-season so some of the facilities that I was looking forward to using was not functional (the jacuzzis). It didn't really feel like a spa/resort for me. On our last day, they also closed the gym early without posting a notice/sign the day before.

This was our first trip to Madeira and we stayed at the Quinta Mirabela. The location has the great plus of having staggering views all over the Bay of Funchal from the terrace. It is half way between Funchal and the hill town of Monte and so you either need to hire a car (there is a car park opposite the hotel) or rely on taxis to go to and from the town or use the occasional bus service which goes from the bottom of the (very steep) hill on which the hotel is located.The Assistant Manager could not have been more welcoming on our arrival and showed us all the facilities of this very modern \boutique\" style hotel. While our room was small it was very stylish and comfortable
month: looking out onto the pool area.The free gym and spa facilities were the best of any small hotel i have ever stayed in and there is free internet use for guests.Breakfast was a good standard apart from the lack of fresh juices and we had one excellent evening meal in the restuarant although service was very slow on a busy evening. The hotel provides a free courtesy bus service to Funchal each morning and evening at set times but to our surprise this didn't operate at weekends.The hotel is on the toboggan route from Monte to Funchal and so you hear the occasional scream from frightened tourists going downhill fast!!Overall we found the hotel of a good standard but it is not a good location for the infirm or for those wanting to be within walking distance of the sights of Funchal."

text: This hotel has the potential to be excellent but it lets itself down in some very key areas.The hotel is in a lovely setting with beautiful views, but there were broken off tiles at the side of the pool that hadn’t been repaired. The sunbeds were plentiful but very uncomfortable.Lunch in the bar area was pleasant enough, although service was very slow and inattentive. We made the mistake of having dinner in The Mare Bistro and this was an awful experience. It took 90 minutes for us to get our main courses, service was very poor and the food, when it eventually came, was horrible. I suspect the pasta was microwaved because it was hot in places and very cold in others, the fajitas looked like dog food and didn’t taste much better, and the steak was overcooked and dry.The beds in the bedrooms were very comfortable and I slept brilliantly.All in all, I don’t think I would recommend this hotel. It’s not cheap and the service really lets it down.

We stayed at this hotel after we had been stranded when my daughter had chicken pox, the insurance sent us hear.The hotel is very pretty but let's say that's all I can say regarding the hotel!Staff on reception rude and extremely un helpful, bar staff barley better.Saying this is an all inclusive hotel is a total lie, extremely minimum food offord, 3 x different choices, no drinks or food out of thr strict timings, no drinks available after 11 ( not even to buy!!)The indoor pool is to be paid for, daily !!!No water machine, was told to get my 18 month baby's water out of the tap!As I say if you would like to stay so where nice do not stay hear go to a 4 star, at least you will get treated as a person

I highly recommend Lisbon Destination Hostel. The staff is amazing, they were really down-to-earth, nice and helpful. The hostel is perfect to visit Lisbon, it was clean and very central! I definitely recommend it to anyone. Thank you guys

Very nice place to stay in Peniche. House is very clean with excellent breakfeast!!! You can surf whole day after that:) Beach can be reached on foot. There is a surf storage place in the basement. Owners are very nice and ready to help with everything. They are organizing  barbecue parties with live music.

Very good price-quality ratio, clean rooms, 24 hours reception, excelent location.We booked private room with bathroom for 2 persons and it was the cheapest one with the private bathroom in the area - basic furniture but desent and clean, very quite for sleeping, not many people around.. it has a shared kitchen area with fridge where you can leave your food..even has dishees for cooking. Within short walking distance to almost all landmarks. Very nice and polite girls who work on the reception.4th floor without elevator but not a big issueNo gustó · Only to say something, they could offer free coffe or tea (at least put a kettle in room). In any case is just to say something..

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Châteaux
text: We stayed for 2 nights and expected a luxury winery with regard to the prices for accommodation and lunch/dinner. As we do have quite a broad experience with such places we were a little bit disappointed as some important details are overlooked. As we arrived we got no introduction to the side and the area about activities. Then, We were sitting at the pool, nobody talking to us, whether serving drinks voluntarily or saying that there will be installed a fence around the pool in a couple of minutes. Some workers came, built the fence in front of us that you feel like an idiot as we managed to order a drink short before they arrived. A nice pool, unusable and framed with an ugly fence disturbing the most beautiful view as nobody was working on the construction side afterwards totally unnecessary. The room was okay, I would give 3 stars from 5 for that. There are walking trails which are nice, but as you go directly out of the room to quite nice orange trees, you pass the burning side for trash including old matraces and plastic packages. This is not luxury. So I Hope you take that as serious advice for increasing quality. The dinner and lunch is tasting really good although it is very pricy for Portugal.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: Disappointing experience — this is not a true luxury property. Guest relations are unresponsive and unhelpful, even when contacted during the stay. Deceptive pricing practices, including hidden gratuities and charges not clearly disclosed. Poor service culture throughout the resort, with staff poorly trained in handling elite status or guest concerns. Definitely not worth the price or reputation.
The show was very entertaining, the dancing people put on a good show and was good entertainment for the show.Thanks to Nirma Cinder Yohandry Leyanna  Ines and Lauro

Have just stayed here for a week. Apartments are large and spacious could not fault them. Avoid the bar it has a horrible smell on entering and the drinks are expensive. The pool bar doesn't open until 12 and the music is much too loud and it's the same music every day!!!!The apartment was not cleaned very well on arrival, toast crumbs ect over the worktops, think they need to speak to the the housekeeper to check rooms prior to letting. Would not say this hotel is a five star more a 3 to 4. Could do with a few more sunbeds and umbrellas.

The bed wasn't the comfiest, the animation team wasn't present all days of my stay or almost absent, otherwise it has been a pleasant experience. The food was good, some days it lacked variation, overall was delicious! It's a big place , but you feel like you don't know where to go to, especially at the beginning of your stay.

The unit is nice and in a scenic location. It is a bit of steep walk down to the beach but not that far. Plenty of restaurants and bars in the town for a lively night life. Only problem we had was the internet was always cutting in and out also the tv signal did the same. The area has a great hiking trail along the cliffs for 11 kms and offers amazing views and vistas. It is called the Seven Valleys trail. There are 7 small quaint beaches along the way. The area is close to many other towns and attractions so plenty to do.

We recently stayed at Casas do Porto, on our first trip to Porto and highly recommended!From the moment we arrived and were greeted by Barbara, who took the time to introduce us to all the amenities, showing us on the map all the great places to visit during our stay and booking our Douro cruise, we felt at home.The suite was beautiful, clean and very comfortable with beautiful views.Rui and Olivia are wonderful, very friendly and attentive to our needs.Thank you Rui, Olivia and Barbara for ensuring that we had a wonderful stay.

Very nice and spacious property. Most staff are very courtesous and friendly. They have a really good lounge with free breakfast, evening drinks and finger foods. BF starats at 630 and gets crowded. Almost everyone seem to have Elite card.Really liked their fitness center

I am due to stay at this hotel in a few weeks.  Today I recieved news that the online company that I booked the hotel through has gone into administration and that my booking with the hotel is likely to be invalid.I need to contact the hotel asap to ensure my booking is still valid, but have had difficulty contacting them. I went on the hotel's website and used there website email but it didn't work.If anyone has an email address, phone number, I would be most grateful.Thank you

We were 3 girls who booked through Jet 2 and would definitely book with them again, flights on time and quick transfer to apartments.  We had a one bedroom apartment on the 5th floor which was clean, very spacious and with a sea view. Apartments were cleaned every other day, although it was more of a quick wipe round than a thorough clean. Clean towels were provided twice during our weeks stay. The bed in living area was a pull out sofa bed and the mattress's were extremely thin. We had to put 2 mattress's on top of one another to make it comfortable, if both beds had to be used don't think you would get a goods night sleep.We went to the beach every day as not much atmosphere at the pool and was also on the receiving end of rude service from the woman who ran the beach bar. Had only been at the pool for an hour on the day of our arrival to be rudely told we couldn't eat our own crisps at the pool and to read the signs. When she was clearing up round the pool we told her which cans which we had purchased from the bar were empty and she told us where the bin was even though she was meant to be clearing up.Beach was only a few minutes walk away and paid 15 euros for 3 beds and an umbrella. But you also were able to use the bed tickets to receive discount at the beach bar. An easy walk to the old town in 15mins, even with heels on, just watch for the cobbles and 10mins in the opposite direction to the strip. Preferred the old town to the strip as the atmosphere more relaxed with a wide range of ages. Would definitely go back to club oceano as long as only 3 to an apartment due to the beds in the living area.

We are regular stayers at the resort and this year here has been some good mprovements. The restaurant offering good value deals on meals is welcome and providing a good buzz with good local live music. The villas are as fab as ever but now with broadband wi fi. The rest of the facilities brilliant as always but nowadays a little cheaper so increasingly good value for money. Take advantage, book in!

We hade a very good stay at this hotel and found the atmosphere warm and pleasant. The dinner at the resturant tasted amazing good served with class and friendliness. I was great after a days walking swim in the pool. We don't mind coming back another time for walking and relaxing. Luxury for mid price!

Excellent staff, facilities, service. Villas spacious and gardens and pools also spacious, beautifully maintained.  Restaurant lovely.  Fun club great and tennis courts included. Soccer organised and well supervised for c'ren 3 evenings a week   We return year after year.

We stayed 5 nights in the Clube Oceano and were very pleased with our apartment. We had a one bedroom apartment which came with a well equipped kitchen and spacious living / dining room area. Overall the apartment was clean and well air conditioned. The beds were comfortable and maid came every day except Sunday. The staff at the apartment are very friendly and helpful and spoke perfect english. We only spend one afternoon at the pool as we prefer the beach. The pool itself is ok but the sunbeds are not very comfortable...The location of Clube Oceano was perfect for us, half way between old town and bottom of the street. It took us approx 15mins walk into the old town at night, however if you prefer a taxi expect to pay about 4 / 5 euros. You can also walk along the beach during the day into the old town. If you like the beach there is a great beach 5 mins walk down hill. Two sunbeds (padded) & a parasol can be rented for the day for 10 euros, however if you go to old town beach expect to pay 15 euros.The supermarket just up from the apartments is reasonable enough and has good selection of wine, fresh fruit, breads etc and not overly priced.Overally would def recommend these apartments to anyone who wants to be within walking distance to the beach and near the old town.

Just got back after 2weeks we love this place! It's  so peaceful and relaxing , location is ideal,  Leo's cafe is so handy for snacks and lovely soup , Christina and Alex keep the place spotless ,  rooms and pool area , it's only a short walk down into town were there is something for everyone . We will be returning again next year , fabulous place .

Clean and large rooms with bathrooms. Fast elevators. Great breakfast buffet! Pool was closed. Free ice machines on each floor. Spa area not checked.Bar in a corner of the lobby - would have been nice if it had been cloed off a bit.

The Montebelo is a clean, comfortable and spacious hotel with a good spa and swinmming pool. Food and restaurant were very good with a wide selection and the staff were very helpful and polite. The value was excellent for the standard of hotel and the view from the dining room is excellent across to the wooded hillsides around the old medieval hill town of Vieso. My room was 329 which had three balconies to catch the sun as it moved round.

Stayed at this hotel for a prolonged weekend in Lisbon. It is a wonderful city and the hotel is very centrally placed in relation to the down town area. the Service was ok although they did not have the room ready at 14.0 as promised but the wait was worth it .. very fresh, clean and everything functioning. The facilities were also fresh and well kept this includes restaurant and pool and everything else. should we go back to the city I would definitely use this hotel again

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: What a wonderful location to stay in LagosHad all the amenitiesPlus clos to beach, town and points of interestBuffet breakfast great all while following Covid protocolWouldn’t hesitate returningPools, while small, were perfect for a quick dip

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Having been here 10 years ago it hasn't changed. This is an old fashioned hotel with old fashioned service. Expect Agatha Christie's Poirot to pop his head around every corner and or Sir Winston Churchill who loved this place and used to spend his time painting the local scenery. The one thing that is not old fashioned are the comfortable rooms with a soft luxurious bed, not an amazing size but big enough and overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. The food down at the Pool bar where they serve breakfast is good and the service attentive. We were part of a large group around 80 people who had use of the Ballroom during our special evening with everyone dressed for the occasion, great fun. Basically you can't fault this hotel it is 5 star through and through, go and enjoy its history, its comfort and its splendid service.

Great hotel with fabulous views and private cove which is slightly tricky to get to so not for the really young or frail.  Hotel gas undergone a refurb and it shows. All parts of the hotel looking very fresh and it has been done to a high standard. Family rooms are really suites but bathrooms are very plus and huge. Sea views are wonderful so probably worth the extra. Staff are excellent and very accommodating. Breakfast was very good quality with and wide choice for everyone.Only gripe was the fact that coffee from Nespresso machine is chargeable. Bit of a joke considering the price of rooms.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Our second visit for afternoon tea and I am sure it will not be the last. Service, quality and atmosphere were top notch!Sandwiches and scones were delicious plus copious amounts of tea.Highly recommend

For a family with three kids, our experience was very very satisfying. The service and kindness of the staff at the reception, the cleanliness of the room and the room itself were great. The swimming pool is a bit small, but very clean and relaxing. Breakfast was rich compared to other hotels we've been to. And they serve a home made vegan yogurt, very tasty!To sum it up, we recommend without a doubt.

We (a family with a 14 year old boy and 11 year old girl) wanted to go to a hotel that focused on relaxation and chilling. The Savoy Saccharum certainly lived up to that requirement! It is a very professionally run and modern hotel with a focus on calm and quiet. It is (deliberately) not a place for families wishing to make noise at the pool. Our children were treated very well but it was clear from the start that they were at an adult hotel without animation/pool activities etc. Not a problem for us as our stay in Madeira was planned with stuff to do on the island every day.The food in the restaurants was very good, The breakfast buffet was fantastic! The other restaurants offered very nice food for adults and had options for the kids to choose although this was more limited. We never used the buffet as it was ridiculously expensive (35 per person in our case, excluding drinks!).We had booked (and paid for) a room with a direct sea view. The room they initially offered us was not such a room. We raised the issue, and the concierge Jose was fantastic. We were given some options (none of which were really what we had paid for) and we settled on a room - 625 - that in fact had a really nice view and was perfect for a family such as ours (it had a separate room with a sofabed for the kids). The hotel also compensated us with cheese and bubbly as compensation for the mix-up. Very professionally done. Jose treated us fantastically throughout our stay. His priority was to make sure we were well looked after and this made the stay wonderful. Thanks Jose!We made good use of the spa and gym. We had to pay extra for the spa. Note that kids under 16 are not allowed access to either. This really is a hotel catering for luxury and wellness for adults.If you are travelling as a couple you will love this hotel! It is designed for you! If you are travelling with children you can have a wonderful time there as long as you are realistic about the options for the kids. My wife and I are already considering going back at the next opportunity when both kids are otherwise engaged...

very enjoyable I will be back!The public areas (bar and lounge) could do with a refurbish...looking a bit old fashioned!I was surprised that there were no showers at the pool area...last day and wandering around trying to find out where to shower before leaving was a challenge!?

This summer I've stayed with 3 friends at the cloud9 hostel for 1 week. We had a great room with our own private balcony and bathroom. Our room was cleaned every morning!The guy that welcomed us at the front desk was really kind. He helped us with finding the right trips, and his recommendations were well estimated!Every evening, the girl from the hostel showed us around all the great pubs in Lagos. That was really fun!There was a tidy kitchen were hostel guest can cook, and a great balcony at the top floor where you can have a drink and have fun with other guests. I would really recommend this hostel, it is the best hostel I've ever been ;)

My family and booked booked to stay at the Royal Savoy for 10 nights.  My wife emailed them to confirm our bookings and request that we had adjoining rooms whic the management confirmed.Upon our arrival, the management told us their were no rooms and that they booked into a hotel some 15minutes outside Funchal which according to TripAdvisor reviews was not the same standard which we rejected. The Booking manager and the general manager of the hotel indicated the problem was now ours.This hotel is not family nor customer friendly and it appeared that half the facilities were closedIt was only when we contacted British Airways that we had the problem resolved

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: This is a charming little hotel in the outskirts of Lagos.Let us be honest. The breakfast is the best thing this place. Both the variety and the staff. The definition of suits here are something else than we are used too. We had a suit but we expected more. It was dark and not so romantic and welcoming.We have three concerns regarding the hotel.1) The cleaning. It was not satisfying. We have to say even dirty and discussing. Especially in the bathroom. See photo.2) The wifi. It was not functional over the whole hotel area. And when functional the speed was really, really slow!3) The distance to the city center. It is a least a 20 min walk down to the city center.We can recommend this place for short stays. We stayed here for 9 nights and won't do that again.

The site is lovely, the staff are friendly, but the pool is letting the site down. There are many dead insects floating on the top, filth and dirt in the base of the pool and half of the tiles missing from the pool base. My daughter and I had to get out of the pool because it was so dirty.

The breakfast was a banquet of fresh food.Francisco who looked after us was very attentive and cooked a lovely scramble eggs.The room was spotless.Amazing views and comfy chairs on balconyLoved the decor of the place.The view is amazing over looking the beachWould love to go back again one day

Abundant and excellent breakfast. Convenient to transport. Excellent location also for getting around on foot. Close to the Rossio train station and metro stopsConvenient for going to high street and indoors.

I would recommend Gat Rossio if you need a city center hotel just for sleeping. Rooms are very small and modest, though practical and clean. Excellent location, walking distance to many good places, that is why I could come again.

Another great stay at these well equipped and clean apartments. Ideally located close to restaurants and shops , all reasonably priced and friendly. Buses run on the nearest street to Falesia,Vilamoura,and Albufeira. There are two beaches about 20minutes walk away but I would recommend going further to Olhos d'gua which is smaller but more traditional village and less commercial.

First impressions are usually the decider for me when checking into a hotel, and I must say that the young receptionist that checked us in for a 9 night stay sold the hotel to me. She was very helpful and efficient.We had booked with Jet2 a suite for the holiday, but the room was not what I considered a suite.Basically we had a bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and a sitting /dining room with a two ring cooker, microwave and fridge and a toilet adjoining. We really weren't interested in cooking on holiday but that's maybe the Portugese suite.The housemaid kept the room very clean each day and all communal areas were kept clean each day. the sea view from the room was nice, overlooking the pool and lounger area and sitting on the balcony at night sipping a gin and tonic watching the sunset was very pleasant.The pool area was again kept clean and tidy, drinks were expensive from the pool bar but again with one exception the staff were friendly and helpful.The afternoon pool sports seemed to be set up for the local youths, and they took over the pool for an hour along with loud music, basically residents couldn't use the pool. The no saving loungers with towels policy didn't seem to be enforced. people vanished for hours on end and the towels stayed put. The pool was salt water but a nice temperature and i noticed that the quality sampling was carried out regularly. The food in the pool area was good and varied each day.The only meals we had was breakfast and a few pool side lunches, the breakfast was good and dishes were replaced quickly if coming empty. The fresh fruit was good and there was always a queue  for the personally cooked omelette.We didn't use any of he other facilities, the indoor pool was usually full of young children and not a option.Wi-Fi was available in the reception and computers were available at reasonable rates.I would suggest that the local bus timetables be available at reception as the hotel is a 5 Euro taxi ride from the town centre.All in all a good hotel and staff very efficient and helpful.As a General Manager for a hotel I feel competent to make the above remarks.

Just finishing off a 7  day break - great hotel, food good for both breakfast and dinner - staff really helpful, nothing is too much trouble - only complaint is the pool attendant who does anything not to work and can be very rude if asked to help - would defiantly come again, but hope if we do they get a new pool attendant

Couldn't fault this place. Central location, close to railway station, a few yards from a Tourist Information Office. Reception staff were friendly and spoke perfect English. We had requested a quiet room on the top floor and thats what we got. Room, albeit on the small side, had a comfy double bed, was spotlessly clean and when I did have one small problem the staff dealt with straight away. The buffet breakfast was perfect for my taste with fruit juices, yoghurts, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, boiled egg, toast and marmalade, fresh fruit. Excellent value for money. We will be back.

We hade a wonderful visit this January(2018), booking in advance for a junior suit with fire place and an experience of being part of history, in this living monument to the past occupants . this being a converted Convent dating back to the 11C. The view across the valley was stunning. The Convent is 4 star and the service excellent. Surrounded by woodland in a quite remote location.We had a log burning in the fire place , although the room was covered by both air conditioner and additional heaters.The bed was very comfortable with excellent mattress and quality natural duvet.

we are just back from our 2nd stay at this wonderful hotel, we stayed with our family (4 rooms in total), and everything was perfect from the start. The staff are so helpful and could not do enough for you, the breakfast staff so efficient, ,and the pool staff were always there when you needed them, especially Frederico who had some great chat!!We stayed in a junior suite, with an extra bed for our daughter (age 10), she loved her own junior toiletries in the bathroom, and her colouring in book was fab.The hotel and grounds are kept in great order, very clean and tidy.We will be back!

We stayed at an apartment at Pestana Viking last week and, overall, it was an enjoyable stay.The reception area is smart with a good outdoor and indoor swimming facility. However, the indoor pool looked a bit murky and, a few years ago, I had a bad ear infection after doing lots of swimming in the indoor pool.Also, the gym area has a few decent machines, mainly weights, but they definitely need to invest in some more cardio machines - they only have 1 old treadmill, one old bike with broken plastic parts, 2 cross trainers (1 with a faulty screen) and a rower with a screen that doesn't work. I came 10 years ago and I don't think these machines have been replaced since - the seat post of the bike keeps dropping as well. So, overall, the gym area is a bit disappointing.Also, the wifi for the apartment was down, apparently due to a fire in one of the garages, which now looks a bit of an eye sore. I believe this has also led to the tennis court looking in a very bad state and not being used. The lack of wifi wasn't great.Also, the bar staff at the pool bar could do with cheering up a bit but it's a good enough facility.In addition, at the round pool, there is now a number lock on one of the gates but the other is open to the public, which doesn't make sense to me, so it would be good if both gates were locked.Overall, the hotel is fine but I wouldn't recommend it as somewhere to go if you want to stay fit while on holiday.

This was a very last minute booking. Passport arrived at 4.30 in the afternoon and we booked this holiday at 5.00pm with the help of the travel agents.Portugal  came up  as quite a good deal along with the hotel/apartment. We flew very early the next morning.On arrival at the hotel the reception was really lovely with a glass waterfall and very modern set up. The room was not ready but we were shown an area to change and to leave our luggage as it was so hot.On getting in to the room it was quite a surprise. We had booked a one bed room apartment for 4 adults. The room was basic with a  bathroom  shower/bath etc, small kitchen with microwave, dishwasher,fridge,etc.  and pull down bed all very new. The great bit was the stairs in the apartment which led to an upstairs bedroom and another bathroom! very basic but with two teenage girls it was a great bonus.The room had a balcony and also its own sun terrace up in the bedroom this was great. Both rooms also had air con which was a plus in the heat we had.The rooms and hotel were very clean and tidy at all times.The staff in the hotel are very friendly and nothing too much trouble.The pool is shared with the apartments next door and during our stay had a new delivery of sunbeds so did not struggle getting a bed everyday.The pool bar is ok  but probably during high season could do with more staff.The hotel is close to the Strip but not too close to be disturbed by noise and about ten taxi mins away from the old town. There is a round about close by with some traffic noise but who cares when you have a pool and sunshine and the double glazing at night does not let traffic sound throughA great stay for a very last min holiday!

hotel_name: Porto PalÃ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Hotel a little far from the city center but easy to access by public transport.- Reception: negative point, no effort to speak French to us (sorry but for a 5* hotel it is the basis to speak several languages). We feel like we're bothering them when we ask them something.- Breakfast: big positive point for the lady who welcomes us. She is very kind and speaks French very well. Large selection of products, there is something for everyone.- Swimming pool: not great, cold water and not a warm place. Swimming cap obligatory â‚¬3 but after a day of walking it feels good.- Room: very spacious, cleaning done every day and towels changed. Little touches (chocolate) left on the desk. The only downside I would say is the stained carpet.Not trying the restaurant because we preferred to eat in more typical, warm and much cheaper places.We had a pleasant stay.

Firstly the hotel has a huge lack of customer service.Place is very dirtyHot tub has visible scum around the rimFood is appalling for vegetariansStaff will fob you off just so they don't have to assist youSofa bed my kids were using was filthy and disgustingWe stayed here for 5 days and towels were never changed nor the room cleanedThe food and beverage manager mentioned above has to be the worst I have come across, he even swore at me. His assistant on duty was much better and in my opinion has better customer service skills then he had. Amshu never assisted or even tried to help our situation but aggravated and made things worse. He was very very rude, swore at me, argued in front of the other guests (having spoken with other restaurant staff along with others guests they all agreed that he was a very rude and an arrogant person).If your vegetarian I wouldn't bother booking half board as you would be expected to eat chips and vegetables daily. My issue that I tried to explain to amshu was that 98% of the guests were meat eaters and so how difficult is it to cater for the 2% of vegetarian guests should they have any special requirements? Amshus assistant agreed and helped alot on our last night as he arranged a nice vegetarian dish for us to eat.Wouldn't recommend this hotel nor stay at that particular branch ever again. IV stayed in many Muthu hotels and have never been treated like this. Certain staff there have really let it down. Cleaning staff, front desk and food beverage staff require additional training. We are paying guests and shouldn't be treated in this manner. I will take this complaint to the highest level to ensure Amshu doesn't treat other guests how we were treated.

We spent 4 nights at the Vila Gale in Tavira and loved the experience, the guest rooms are spacious as are all the public areas including the pool. The entire hotel has tiled floors which gives a clean spacious feel to the property. The staff were friendly and aways helpful and the buffet breakfast is generous and of excellent choice and quality. The town of Tavira is unspoilt and quiet and the food at the local restaurants is inexpensive and good quality.

Staff very good and attentive breakfast very nice plenty of topping up going on .very good location close to all restaurants and easy reach of beaches. No car required .the little trains .and ferry .local taxis very reasonable and excellent service .

We had a fantastic stay at Eurostars Porto Douro! The location is perfect — right in Porto with easy access to the main attractions and beautiful riverside views. The hotel is modern, stylish, and very comfortable, with clean rooms and thoughtful amenities.The rooftop terrace was a true highlight — stunning views over the Douro River and a perfect spot to relax. The staff were friendly and welcoming, making our stay even more enjoyable. We loved every moment and would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Cidnay Santo Tirso - Charming Hotel & Executive Center
text: This hotel is one of my personal favourites. I have visited many times and I'm sure I'll visit, many more.Situated in a quiet spot on the edge of town and about a 25 minute drive from Porto Airport, the rear of the hotel overlooks fields and orchards, providing beautiful views whilst eating breakfast (which is one of the most varied and high-quality buffets I've tried) and a perfect start to the day.There is also a separate bar (where you can also eat) and terrace overlooking this area, too.The staff are very attentive and nothing is too much trouble. The front desk can staff speak multiple languages which makes visitors feel more comfortable with their stay.The room are very comfortable and well appointed with workspace area, WiFI, large screen TV and an excellent minibar which puts some higher-end hotels to shame.A great mix of tranquility, with the option of visiting the bustling town if you want to be somewhere more lively. It's been consistently excellent and I've been regularly staying here for the last four years.

Magical in every way. The hotel, estate, food and drink, and THE STAFF! I’ve never felt more welcomed and have made more connections with the staff like here.We did bee keeping, star gazing, walking tour tour and the jeep tour. All of the food and bev was outstanding.The staff is otherworldly. So kind and such beautiful souls. Thank you to Filipa, Fabio, Martin, Stefan, João (the legend bartender), Pedo & Caterina and everyone else we interacted with. You are incredible. In João’s words, never change! :-)We miss you already but will see you again soon. Thank you!

We had a wonderful three night stay at Canto de Luz. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, incredibly comfortable, stylish rooms and a delicious breakfast. The staff are incredibly attentive and weâ€™ll definitely be back.

I wish I could give a better review to this hotel, but honestly I can't. The customer service is very lukewarm, they really need some training and learn how to appreciate customers without showing attitude. The carpets in the room were heavily deodorized, and smelled too much with artificial smell. In that area of Lisbon, Saldanha, one can find other, better hotels in the same price range.

There is a lot to be said for where your hotel is in Lisbon.This hotel provides a good breakfast and very comfortable rooms.We found that we could walk to nearly all the things we wanted to see and it was close enough to the trams and the Metro to cover off on the others.

We stayed for one night ,March 22,  here and were totally happy. The bed was comfortable, the most important thing. The room was huge with a couple of chairs.  A pair of additional chairs on the balcony were available. The bathroom was clean, large and well equipped including bathrobes. Breakfast was an extensive buffet with enough choices for a healthy, nutritious meal.There is elevator service to all floors.The location is perfect.  We walked to town for supper. If we’d had energy to spare and it hadn’t been raining, we could have walked up the hill to the Convento.Based on our experience this seems to be the best option for accommodation in Tomar.

The positive reviews reflect how nice this hotel is . It's down to the lovely staff really but location is also good . On a busy roundabout but noise nuisance is ok with windows closed .  Just a short stroll down to town . Tour buses based across the road and metro right outside the hotel .If you need a local restaurant there is one up the hill near the hotel which is very homely and good value .The hotel is very clean but just sometimes the room servicing  missed cleaning the cups /glasses I had used . Otherwise would have been a 5 star review .  However it's more about the people and thank you to all the lovely staff in this hotel for your hospitality .

Don’t expect to get into the Michelin starred restaurant- we tried for the  six days we were here and failed. Almost as bad in their other restaurants. My wife was so horribly treated in their spa she felt humiliated in front of other guests and came away tearful. Despite booking in advance she was turned away and told she couldn’t have a foot and lower leg massage because she had breast cancer. Their level of communication is awful and complaining to so-called guest relations an infuriating waste of time. If cancer patients are to be excluded, then they need to be explicitly told so beforehand . That said, there is no medical reason why anyone on oral chemotherapy need be refused a foot massage - indeed it’s one of the things oncologists encourage. Staff in the bars and breakfast rooms were wonderful but I’d rather drink bleach than ever stay here again!

My kids and I stayed 9 nights in the Bahia Palace and had the most wonderful time.  The thing that was most special was the attitude of the staff.  I arrived in a bit of a panic because I had been unable to hire a car online and at the airport I had been assured that there were no hire cars available until October, this in mid-August.  On my first morning, Nelson found me a car within 30 seconds.  Not for nothing has he been awarded employee of the month for several months running but he is ably assisted by Dora, Lucia, Priscilla and Anna and others whose name I did not learn.  They helped us with maps, gave restaurant recommendations, got us taxis, printed out our boarding passes and delivered them at midnight to our door and then sent an email to check we had got them.  But what about the hotel? Yes, a little faded from past glories but still our room was huge, was kept clean, had a wonderful balcony with a wonderful view and I miss that huge marble bathroom.  There was tennis and table tennis and a pool table.  The pool was wonderful and there were always sun loungers available and clean towels were provided daily.  And the beach was just glorious and was just a short walk away.  The only downside was the food was not perfect.  I found breakfast the least inspiring with sugary fruit juice drinks, coffee from a machine and processed cheese when there is so much nice cheese on the island.  Dinners a la carte were good though and the serving staff were always the same so you got to know them and they were always smiling and helpful.  Highly recommended though I am glad we got that car. There is a minibus daily to Ponta Delgada and you are on a major bus route.

Can I just commend them on how clean the bathrooms were (which is very important), the cleaners were visible and made sure everything was in order. They also have these delicious three course dinners with free drinks for only 10 euros! As a solo traveler, the set up of the hostel (home style dinners, good breakfast, pub crawl) made it easy to meet other travelers and made my stay even more memorable :)The staff are also very nice and ready to help, (shout-out to G! :) ) I'd definitely stay there again if I'm ever in Lisbon.

Very clean and comfortable rooms. The hotel has a private access to the beach, including a terrace, reclining seats and various spots to enjoy the sun setting at the end of the day. The staff is very helpful and a nice breakfast is served every day.

The hotel is within walking distance of almost all tourist attractions. It has 2 swimming pools (interior and exterior), the rooms were clean and quite big. The breakfast was good, it has a nice bar if you want to relax at the end of the day. It also has a big parking lot where you can leave your car.

We had a lovely stay at the newly-renewed Onyria Quinta da Marinha. The rooms have been vastly improved and the common areas are excellent. The hotel is doing a good job Covid-wise and we felt very safe at all stages.The golf course was well maintained during the closure and is now is in excellent shape.Overall, I would recommend it for both couples and for groups of all sizes.

I enjoyed my stay in Vila Galé very much. Easy parking, great reception area and hotel bar, really (!) nice room with a balcony and river view on the 2nd floor. All staff are very friendly and helpfull. Location could be much better though: it's a 25 minute walk downtown through a very shady neighbourhood.

We had a family reunion in the hotel and loved it. It is very good for couples and families. The facilities and service was great. The golf course is managed very efficiently and is a very enjoyable experience. Will definitely come back!

date: Antonio Costa P... Swrote a review Jun 2024
text: I slept like I was at home in my bed.The breakfast was varied and delicious.The building is spectacular.  I was sorry I didn't use the pool but lack of time didn't allow it.The staff was very attentive and always ready to help with any questions you had.
